title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: Africa’s mpox epidemic no longer an international emergency, WHO says
items.description: The disease continues to spread in several African countries, but cases are down after an explosion in 2024

items.title: Thawing permafrost is turning Arctic rivers orange—spelling trouble for fish
items.description: In Alaska’s Salmon River, leached metals reach levels that are toxic for aquatic life

items.title: Florida plans to nix vaccine mandates. How well do they work?
items.description: Abandoning long-standing vaccine requirements for schoolchildren could prompt bigger outbreaks, researchers warn

items.title: U.S. will fulfill Biden-era pledge to provide HIV prevention breakthrough to millions
items.description: Trump administration cuts to global health programs had put promise in doubt

items.title: Could a giant dam save the Atlantic currents that keep Europe warm?
items.description: Geoengineering scheme that would block the Bering Strait could kill the ocean circulation it’s meant to protect, researchers warn

items.title: How do giant sperm avoid getting tangled up?
items.description: Study in fruit flies sheds light on quirk of insect fertility

items.title: Harvard victory leaves scientists feeling vindicated but uncertain
items.description: Trump administration vows to appeal ruling that it illegally cut $2.2 billion in research funding

items.title: The last gift: How bodies donated for research may help find a cure for HIV
items.description: Pioneering project uses “rapid autopsies” to find virus hideouts in infected people

items.title: New ‘hyperlocal’ forecasts aim to give Indian cities early warning of monsoon floods
items.description: In Mumbai, new tools provided up to 3 days notice of dangerous downpours

items.title: After ‘humiliating’ raid, Burkina Faso halts ‘gene drive’ project to fight malaria
items.description: Disinformation campaign may have triggered “brutal” shutdown of mosquito lab
